question: 'Seek good, and not evil that you may live, and so the Lord, the God of host, will be with you, as you have said...' Which prophet gave this advice?

And at the time of the offering of the oblation, the prophet came near and said, .... O Lord, answer me, that this people may know that thou, O Lord, art God, and that thou has turned their hearts back' what happened after this prayer ?
explanation:
1Kings 18:36-38

36 At the time of sacrifice, the prophet Elijah stepped forward and prayed: “Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, let it be known today that you are God in Israel and that I am your servant and have done all these things at your command. 37 Answer me, Lord, answer me, so these people will know that you, Lord, are God, and that you are turning their hearts back again.”

38 Then the fire of the Lord fell and burned up the sacrifice, the wood, the stones and the soil, and also licked up the water in the trench.

question: One of the reasons why Sennacherib could not enter Jerusalem and conquer it as he did to Samaria was that
options: his god told him to return home from his camp
thousands of his soldiers miraculosly died overnight
he willingly change his mind and returned to his country
fight broke out among his soldiers

question: When the Chaldean army captured king Zedekiah, they
explanation:
King Zedekiah attempted to flee that final siege, and was captured and taken prisoner. He saw his sons slaughtered before his eyes, his own eyes were then burned out with red hot irons and he was taken away in chains to prison and exile.

Jeremiah 52: 10 There at Riblah the king of Babylon slaughtered Zedekiah’s sons before his eyes, and he also killed all the officials of Judah
options: slew his sons before his eyes
cut off his fingers and toes

question: 'All we like sheep have gone astray, we have turned every one to his own way, and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all'. This messianic prophecy was made by
The vision of 'dry bones' teaches that

there will be a new creation
